choices: Make first contact with an alien race
Consult the alien embassy for advice
1.content:
Space. The final frontier. Humanity had finally started expanding beyond the confines of Earth. With the home world peacefully unified under the United Nations of Earth, scientific missions slowly turned into permanent colonies in the solar system. Now, in addition to the UNE, the Republic of Mars, Ceres Consortium, and Confederacy of Jovian Moons all work to expanding our reach to the stars. But interstellar travel seemed hopelessly beyond our grasp, our fastest ships confined to a fraction of light speed. At least until they came.

They called themselves the Erimosi. They were humanoid, and to our eyes looked like tall, statuesque men and women with jet black skin and snow white hair. Otherwise they could pass for a human. We were lucky that the first advanced alien race we met was also so peaceful and benevolent.

They were happy to share the secrets of warp drive with us, and to start telling us about the galaxy. In exchange, they only wanted to learn as much as they could about humanity, something that interested them endlessly. For instance, they were amused to learn about our male dominated past, and our 50/50 gender ratios. Apparently this was an oddity, and most sentient races were 90/10 female to male, something the Erimosi considered ideal for perpetuating the species. They also speculated that so many males was a cause for our violent and warlike past.

It was clear that the Erimosi weren't telling us everything. They admitted as much. We were told that many of the humanoid galactic races had 'strange customs,' to which humanity would be particularly 'vulnerable.' They wouldn't say more about this, simply saying we would have to understand this first hand. The Erimosi told us they had decided, with much restraint, that they would not engage in these 'customs' with us. At least not until they thought we were ready.

But with their help, humanity started building scoutships and training scouts to begin exploring the galaxy on our own. They were to be small one-man craft, built to travel long distances quickly. There were to be no weapons, unless you counted overloading the communication laser as a 'weapon.' The ship would be provided with some information from the Erimosi, as well as an artificial intelligence to operate as the ship's computer.

This is where you come in. You've graduated at the top of the first class of scouts. You've trained in simulations on how to operate the ship, as well as first contact protocols. The first scoutship prototype as just rolled off the assembly line: The SP-001 Swift Feather. The second won't be completed for months, giving you first pick as to where to explore.

---

You put on your new space suit and head to the hanger. The suit covers you completely from your neck down to your fingers and toes. It's a surprisingly thin, skin-tight fabric provided by the Erimosi. It's able to protect your body against extreme heat and cold, radiation, and hostile atmospheres; all while preserving mobility and the sense of touch. It's an amazing material, years ahead of anything that can be made on Earth. A small device has been inserted in your ears to act as a universal translator, as well as act as a short-range communication device with your shipboard AI.

"Hello, Pilot!" A young, feminine voice exclaims in your ear. "I'm the artificial intelligence for the Swift Feather! Ar-in version 12.7.2 to be exact, but you can just call me 'Erin.' It's a lot more personal that way." You didn't expect the new AI to be so… bubbly. Yet another invention that's light years ahead of humanity. No human computer program is remotely capable of emoting anywhere near the level you just heard. You just hope the AI is also an equally competent navigator.

"Hello… Erin. I'm your pilot." you say to Erin as you approach your ship, getting used to referring to your computer by name. The Swift Feather is a marvel, a sleek bullet shaped craft made mostly of engine, with anti-matter conventional thrusters as well as the massive warp drive capable of jumping dozens of light years in a single bound. You run your gloved hand along the white metallic surface, the suit conveying the touch as well as if it were with bare fingertips.

"Hey," Erin interrupts you, "you want to feel me up for a while, or do you want to hop in and get started?" The chastisement from the AI oddly embarrassed you, and you stop inspecting the hull and enter the ship itself. The cabin is small: there's a bunk along one wall, a food dispenser along the other, and then the cockpit area. But it's a small price to pay for the benefit of being able to blast off into the unknown reaches of a galaxy filled with alien races and exotic planets.

You sit down in the cockpit, leaning back in the comfortable pilot seat which seems to mold to your form. You look over the panoply of controls and displays in front of you, and realize you're not entirely sure where to begin. "Now, where to go first?" You wonder aloud.

"There are plenty of options!" Erin pipes up cheerfully. "You could make a first contact with an alien race. The Erimosi have put a number of nearby humanoid species into my memory banks, so I can give you a brief description of the best targets to start with.

"You could also scout a potential colony world in another solar system for you humans." Erin continues. "There are a number of candidates, and a survey of the colony world will be crucial to the planning efforts.

"You could also travel into unmapped space. As you know, the galaxy is a very large place. Even the Erimosi have not traveled to most of it. However, I'm programmed to warn you against this action. The Erimosi cannot predict what might happen in unmapped space. It could be dangerous, and potentially harmful to your person. Not to mention your lovable ship AI." Erin adds, prompting you to roll your eyes at the computer's personality.

"Finally, if you are still unsure what course of action to take, you could consult the Erimosi for advice. I am certain they will happily receive you at their embassy on Phobos, Mars's larger moon." You sit in your chair and ponder your expansive options. So much to do, and the choice is yours. Where to start?
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
You decide that making first contact would be the best way to go. Right now, the only alien race humans know about are the Erimosi. It'd be good to know the neighbors, and have a better understanding of who's nearby. Besides, it'd be pretty cool to meet new alien races. "Erin, give me the list of best aliens to make first contact with." You tell your ship AI.

"Of course!" It/she replies happily. "I'll give you an overview of the top four candidates, identified by the Erimosi as best for humans to encounter. The Erimosi gave priority to proximity to Sol system and humanoid appearance. These major priorities were weighted at a ratio of 7:2 against the minor categories of…"

"Alright, alright!" you stop Erin before she goes into excessive detail. "I'll trust that it’s a good list. We're all very grateful to the Erimosi for all their help and guidance, and they haven't steered us wrong yet. Just tell me about these top four aliens."

"Can do, captain!" Erin complies easily. The outlines of four humanoid figures appear on your screen. Mostly humanoid, at least. The first two appear normal, although the outlines appear fuzzy. On further inspection, you notice the second outline has pointed ears at the top of its head, reminiscent of a cat or a dog. The third being is human above the waist, but appears to have a snake-like lower half. And the last one appears to have four arms. All things considered, that's about as close to human as you think you're going to get. Not that you'd know any better.

"These are the Ufu, Yathi, Kichi, and Giglin." Erin tells you, as each silhouette is highlighted in its turn. "Which one do you want to know more about?" Your eyes narrow. A physical outline isn't exactly much to go on, but at least she's giving you the choice of where to start. But which to choose?
11.title: First Contact

choices: Travel to an Ufu scientific outpost
111.content:
"Tell me more about the Ufu." you tell Erin. The first silhouette promptly expands to take up the entire screen on your command.

I can give you a picture of one of them." Erin brings up an image of an Ufu on your main viewer. It's a female approximately five feet tall, with crimson eyes and snow white skin along with a covering of what appear to be white feathers. Long white feathers cover her head in an approximation of shoulder length human hair. Shorter, medium length feathers appear to cover the arms, legs, and back of the creature. Very short feathers of a soft, downy appearance cover her front, starting at her neck and continuing down her breasts, flat toned stomach, and inner thighs. You notice that you can make out a narrow indentation in the feathers for her navel, and observe that were she human, she'd be in good shape and rather attractive. Black clothing that looks like underwear or a bikini cover her. You can't tell if this is normal clothing for her race, or if this is merely for the purposes of presenting a more complete physical image.

"This is an Ufi. One Ufi, multiple Ufu, got it? The Ufu are considered to be a very friendly and affectionate race," Erin tells you, "making them ideal for human contact. Their culture is based on the mutual giving of gifts and services. I should note that the Ufu consider it quite rude to refuse their generosity. Otherwise they are very amicable. The Ufu have heavily colonized a number of worlds, and are a major race in the region. Because of their disposition, location, and political influence, the Erimosi recommend you contact this race first."

You nod as you continue to look at the image. Despite the obviously alien features, the woman shown is quite beautiful. Friendly, affectionate, beautiful, and close by? That does sound like a perfect recipe for a friendship with Earth. And if they all look like her, you wouldn't mind getting to know them personally. "That's good enough for me." You say to your computer. "What are the recommendations for first contact?"

"Excellent choice, captain! There are three equally valid procedures for you!" Erin responds happily. You can't tell if the way she responds is her 'natural' enthusiasm, or if there's a hint of humoring you in her voice. Either way, she continues. "First, there's always the straightforward approach. We can warp to the Ufu home system, and hail them on universal frequencies. In all likelihood, they'll direct you a landing zone, where you can introduce yourself! I'm sure they'll be very interested in learning about a new sentient race."

"That approach does make sense." you agree. "Their homeworld is probably where their ambassadors are."

"Not to mention their xenobiologists." Erin says. "They will probably want to make a physical examination of you at some point." Getting a physical from an alien gives you a bit of pause, but you do see the point. It's probably important for any alien to learn what you can eat, what harms humans, and of course general scientific curiosity. While it might be an annoyance, it is your duty when you took this job.

"Another option would be to contact a remote outpost." Erin chirps. "By contacting a small group of scientists, you will have the advantage of interacting with a group interested in learning about alien things, but also the intimacy of a small number of them. After you've sufficiently introduced yourself, those scientists can act as a liaison between you and the rest of the Ufu. We already have the location of an Ufu outpost that would be suitable.

"And the final option would be to make contact in interstellar space. Neutral ground is a bit less intrusive, and puts both parties on equal footing. It also allows them to willingly come to you! We can sit and direct a contact request directly at Ufu space until they arrive. Since the Ufu are friendly, they'll probably show up in a matter of minutes!" Erin tells you, running down the three options.

You have to agree, all those approaches make sense in their own way. Going to their homeworld is logical, but you'd be outnumbered by over a billion to one. That could be a little overwhelming. Visiting the outpost would be more manageable, but if the scientists don't want to be distracted from whatever work they're doing, you might not be welcome. Finally, making a space contact solves both those problems, but there's the risk the Ufu might not want to come. It also means you'd be cooped up inside starships for even longer. Mulling your options, you decide the best course of action would be to:
111.title: Ufu

choices: The crowd starts to close around you.
The Prime Minister walks up to you...
1111.content:
"If they're as friendly as you say they are, Erin, then let's just go right to their homeworld." You tell your computer, hoping that this would be an easy and fun mission.

"Aye aye, captain!" Erin complies with her usual enthusiasm. "Setting course for Uf Prime, prepare for warp jump!" The display in front of you lights up with course calculations and readings from the warp drive. While it's for your benefit, Erin is operating the ship faster than you can keep up with. Your happy to have an AI like her to keep the ship running quickly and efficiently. It'd take you much longer to look up the coordinates, then calculate and execute the jump properly.

Then it happens, faster than light travel! It happens in an instant, your vision blurring with the uneasiness that comes from being in warp space. When your sight clears, the stars have changed, and a large blue-green orb not unlike Earth fills a quarter of the view screen. There's a little less ocean than Earth, and from the look of the lights on the night-side of the planet, many more cities. You wonder how many Ufu populate their homeworld.

You pull up what data you have on Uf Prime: the planet is about 70% the size of earth, and about as much gravity. You'll be a little lighter down there, and have a little more spring in your step, which you hope doesn't result in you falling on your face. The planet is about half ocean, half land, with extensive forest cover outside of the cities. The population of Uf Prime is over 20 billion! Clearly, the Ufu don't mind crowds. You decide to look over the details some other time, as you've got more important matters to attend to. A blinking light indicates your being hailed.

"Unknown alien vessel, this is Uf Prime Traffic Control." A girlish but professional sounding voice sounds in your speakers. "Please identify yourself and your destination." Your screen fills with a visual of the woman's feathered head. The plumage is a robin's egg blue, her face a snowy white. Her eyes have the same albino-red look that the image in your databank showed. She isn't wearing any clothing on her head, but you can't see her from the neck down to get a sense of that.

"Hello!" you reply. "I am a human from the planet Earth, and this is my vessel Swift Feather. My mission is to introduce myself on behalf of my species to our galactic neighbors. We come in peace!" You feel like you said that rather well, and mentally congratulate yourself on the important first step.

"What? A first contact?!" The Ufi's eyes widen in what looks like surprise. "Uh… h-hello! We welcome you to Uf Prime! We haven't had a first contact in over ten years!" She says, and as she talks Erin quietly shows you a conversation to about 16 Earth years. "The Prime Minister and Minister of Science will both want to speak with you. I'm transmitting landing coordinates to you now. You've been given priority clearance to land in the Capital." While you can tell she's talking in a profoundly alien language, your translator mutes the incomprehensible sounds and reproduces them in your ear in English.

"Thank you, Traffic Control. I would be honored to meet with the Prime Minister and the Minister of Science," you tell her graciously, signing off. The coordinates are put into your computer, and Erin effortlessly pilots you down through the atmosphere, giving you a few moments to think. You're getting to meet the leader of the whole planet, maybe their entire species! Erin told you the Ufu have heavily colonized a number of nearby worlds. If they're anywhere near as populated as this one, that makes this Prime Minister a very important person. And the other sent to meet you is the science advisor. This gives you a sense of their priorities. You wonder what sort of questions the science minister will have for you.

The ship lands quickly, descending gently onto an overly large landing pad. It appears to be specially for the Capitol building, as right in front of you is a large building that looks important, with domed spires that remind you of minarets on Earth. A quick glance at your instruments shows you the air here is perfectly breathable, even with a little extra oxygen than you're used to. Not bothering with a helmet, you step outside.

Walking out onto the platform, you see a crowd starting to gather, dozens of Ufu milling around some distance away, with more showing up every moment. It was a sea of varied pastels, with feathers of pink, gold, tan, and blue covering their bodies. Many had those blood-red eyes, but others were of brilliant blue, and some seemed to be a pale gold. All of them were short, at least by human standards, and seemed to be overwhelmingly female. You could easily tell this based on their clothing, or rather, lack of clothing. Glossy black garments like the one you saw on your ship was apparently standard attire, although some seemed to pick other colors. Clearly, Ufu didn't care much for modesty, not that you minded at all.

Stepping past the throng were two figures. One was a step forward than the other, and you guessed this was the Prime Minister. Her feathers were a pastel pink, her eyes bright red. She wore the same skimpy black bikini, but with some kind of lapel pinned to her left breast. Behind her, with pure white plumage and blue eyes, was the Science Minister. Both looked at you with a pleasant and curious expression. You returned their gaze, trying not to ogle their exposed bodies.

The Prime Minister stopped, and began to speak. "Greetings, Uman," she said, and you decided now wasn't the time to correct her pronunciation. "I am Prime Minister Iyafya, leader of the Ufu people. This is my Minister of Science, Yedah." She gestured to the white-feathered woman beside her, who bowed slightly, a gesture you returned. "On behalf of my people, I welcome you to our homeworld, and hope that our races can interact with friendship and laughter." Hmm, that phrasing was a bit odd, but then again, they were aliens. You bow again, and begin to speak, but before you do...
1111.title: Visit the Ufu Homeworld

choices: Led away to the Prime Minister
Taken by that first pair of Ufi, leading you to a secret tunnel
11111.content:
You were about to start saying something. Something about getting along peacefully between two alien races, learning from each other, and becoming friends. All the standard diplomatic stuff you’ve trained for, memorizing all those carefully crafted speeches you memorized at the academy. This was all pretty much going exactly as you had planned.

But then the crowd started to move. There must be hundreds of Ufi crowding around you, a sea of curious faces looking at you. It feels a little strange to be the object of attention to so many people, but you are a strange alien they’ve never seen before. But… the crowd was definitely getting closer now. As if unable to restrain themselves any longer, some of the more ambitious Ufi were walking up to you. They started to speak to you, although they were doing it all at once.

“Greetings, Uman!” said a cheerful pink-feathered female Ufu. “I am Tatyal of….” “Uman! My name is Zyosha…” you heard another say, this one with pale yellow feathers. “Uman!” “Greetings!” “Welcome!”You heard more and more try to introduce themselves to you, making you feel like a celebrity in a throng of fans. The Ufi were now right next to you, trying to get your attention.

“Hello, everyone! Please, one at a time!” You try to say loudly and slowly to the crowd. “I can’t understand if-aha!” You gasp and jump a little in surprise. An Ufu to your right was trying to get your attention, and reached out a feathered hand to brush against your right side. And that feather touch really tickled! The suit did nothing to dampen the sensation of soft feathers moving against your sensitive skin. Unfortunately, your jump moved you in the direction of the blue Ufu… Tatyal? Who reached out to put her hands against your ribs. As she steadied you, her hands moved and squeezed ever so slightly, but even that little touch was more than enough to tickle you again, prompting another flinch and gasp.

Your jumpiness was not lost on the Ufi around you. The crowd murmur rose, and they seemed to speak quickly and excitedly to themselves. You couldn’t make out exactly what they were saying. Although at the moment, you didn’t really care. A wide eyed pink Ufu reached out to deliberately brush her hands across your stomach, running feathery fingers along the tight thin fabric of your suit just below your navel. The ticklish feeling of feathers and fingers lightly but somehow deliberately tickling along the smooth skin was impossible to ignore, and you sucked in your quivering stomach with a giggle.

“Hehe, h-hey guys… cut it out! That kind of tickles-s-s-ehehe!” You stutter, as the crowd tightens around you. Somehow, telling them that they were tickling you didn’t have the desired effect. Instead of backing off, the Ufi around you got even more excited. You felt hands reach out all around you, stroking and brushing against your whole body, as you let out a burst of ticklish laughter.

“The Uman is tickish!” “Listen to it laugh!” “Sister, here! This spot is very ticklish!” “Ah, the Uman has a sensitive belly, see!” “And here as well!” You could hear the Ufi crowd seem to marvel at your ticklishness, reaching out feathery hands to explore and confirm for themselves as they chattered quickly in their own language, too much for the translator to keep up. And here you were, squirming from the grasp of one Ufu to another, as hands pawed at every ticklish spot you had!

Suddenly, two hands reached out and clasped onto your wrists, pulling at them. In your distracted state, you found yourself being...
11111.title: The crowd starts to close around you.

11112.content:
“Human, if you could come with us, we have much to discuss,” Yedah interrupts your thought process.

“Of course,” you respond, desiring to appease whatever the Ufu say. You go to Iyafya and Yedah, and they start to lead you through the crowd, with security clearing a path for you. The two Ufu take you inside the Capitol building to a room with many tables and devices, which you presume is a science lab.

“Please sit down,” Yedah gestures you to one of the tables. You do so, and three more Ufu, who you believe are scientists, enter the room. “These are my assistants. Right now, you are in the foreign species lab of Uf Prime. It is the first place that we take new species to when we meet them. We want to learn about your species, and the best way to start to learn about you is through a physical. Are we ready?” One of the Ufi assistants nods her head, so Yedah continues, “Could you please stand up and go to my assistant Allena? She will measure your height and weight so we can get a base measurement for humans.”

You stand up and head over to Allena, who has you stand against the wall of the room. When you go against the wall, she places her feathery hand at the top of your head, motioning for you to step away. “Subject is around thirty-three woffs tall,” Allena announces, and Erin tells you that this converts to 1.65 m on Earth through your ear translator.

“Thank you,” Yedah replies. “For comparison, Ufu are usually around twenty-eight to thirty woffs tall, so it appears that humans are slightly taller than us. Next up, Allena will take your weight on the scale.”

Allena motions for you to come over and step onto a scale. When you get on, some strange numbers show up on the screen. “Subject is 1572 joals,” she reports she indicates that you can get off. Erin quickly gives you a conversion to around 69 kilograms.

“That sounds like a reasonable weight,” Yedah observes. “The typical Ufi is somewhere around 1600 joals, so we are very similar races. Now for the last part of the physical, we need you to lie down on the table. We also need you to remove your shoes and socks, as they will get in the way. Lastly, you need to raise the top part of your spacesuit so that we can see your stomach.”

Although you find the last two requests a little strange, you think to yourself that the Ufu probably have good reasons for what they are asking you to do. In accordance with this, you bend down and remove your shoes and socks. You get up onto the table and then pull up the top of your spacesuit, showing off your slender abdomen to the aliens. Once this is done, you lay down, feeling the coldness of the table on your bare back. “Please raise your arms in the air,” Allena requests. You obey, and one of the Ufi straps your wrists to the table; while this is happening, another Ufi straps your ankles down. “I apologize if this seems mean, but it is necessary for the test. In addition to the restraints, we are going to hook up some equipment to you so that we can measure the results.”

You nod and lift your head up. “I don’t mean to sound intrusive, but what exactly is this test?” you ask Yedah.

“In accordance with our desire that our races share both friendship and laughter, we need to test how ticklish you are,” the Science Minister notifies you. “In addition to this, the test will show where you are most ticklish, which will tell us how we both can best enjoy the relationship between our species.”

“Alright,” you state, now a little nervous, although it does not show on the outside. You are very ticklish, and now the Ufu have you tied up just for tickling. Then again, it couldn’t be that bad, could it? It is just tickling, not some form of torture that they will use against you. Suddenly, you remember something that makes you shiver, although not enough for anyone to notice: Yedah made you bare your belly and your feet in preparation for the test.

“Okay, I think we are ready to begin the test,” Allena proclaims. While you were asking Yedah about the test and thinking about what was to come, she had hooked up all the equipment to your arms and legs. “We will start with the alien’s…”
11112.title: The Science Minister speaks

111123.content:
"...Underarms, " Allena continued. Immediately your eyes widened with fear. You were insanely ticklish on your armpits and they were going for them from the get-go? You steeled yourself as Allena and Yedah approached you from either side.

You gulped audibly as the Ufu duo proceeded to reach their feathery forearms out and began waving them gently about your armpits. "E-eheheheep! Ohoho my gohohohod!" was all you could manage to respond with, along with a few jerks as you struggle helplessly.

"Not bad. But how will you react if I were to do this?" Allena began cutting up the sleeves of your spacesuit, exposing your bare underarms. "Don't worry, we'll fix it after!" she added, not making you feel much better in the current situation.

In an effort to tease you, the two scientists were wiggling their menacing fingers in the air just before slowly descending onto your poor armpits. In an instant, they began scribbling their deft fingers in and around your smooth hollows. "AHAHAHAA, OKAHAHAY, OKAHAHAY! PLEHEHEHASE STAHAHAHAP!" you yelped, arching your back and fighting back as much as possible, trying to pull your arms down.

The natural feathers of the Ufu around their wrists also made it an unbearable, tickly situation for you. They continued to spider their soft fingertips, dancing around the edge of your hollows teasingly. With Allena on your right and Yedah on your left, they drilled their fingers deep into your hollows, driving you crazy. Your laughter was met with cute giggles by the two scientists, showing amusement in your plight. "OHOHOHOO! NOHOHOHOO MOHOHOHORE! AHAHAHAHAHAA!" was all you could sputter.

After what seemed like hours, they stopped the assault on your armpits. "Okay, looks like your armpits are unbearably ticklish!" Allena commented as she wrote down her findings. "Now, let's take a look at your... "
111123.title: Underarms

choices: Rendezvous with the Erimosi ship with the injured Yathi
112.content:
"Tell me more about these Yathi." you tell Erin. Your screen fills with an image of one of them. The Yathi is female, and according the description stands 6'7" (200 cm) tall, which is apparently the standard height for Yathi women. The most prominent non-human characteristic is the covering of short, grey fur across the entirety of her body. She also appears to have pointed ears coming out of the top of her head. The two facts remind you of a cat or a dog, although considering her humanoid features and size, the image of a werewolf also springs to mind. The only clothing the Yathi seems to be wearing is a sash of some kind that functions as a short skirt tied asymmetrically around one hip, hanging low on the other. It covers her nether-region, but the rest of her is bare. Either the fur suffices for these people, or this image is merely for your edification. At any rate, you notice her figure: firm, large breasts; the soft outlines of musculature on her arms and legs underneath the short fur; the faint marking of ab muscles on her taut stomach; short claws on her fingers and toes; and sharp teeth barely visible behind parted lips.

"The Yathi are a warrior race with a strict honor code." Erin tells you, describing the species as you carefully examine the slowly rotating image. "While they are a relatively new species in the galaxy, they have expanded aggressively to over a dozen systems. Their ships are small, containing no more than a handful of crew, but heavily armed and shielded. This makes them slow to maneuver, but unmatched in close quarters. The Yathi themselves are physically quite strong, as their homeworld experiences high gravity. I believe you have noticed the musculature. However, this makes them significantly uncomfortable in zero-g situations, and…"

"Wait, wait!" You say, stopping Erin's soliloquy on the Yathi, who sound more dangerous by the second. "Why would we want to make contact with them? They sound like they'll just eat me, and hunt down us weak Earthlings!"

"Don't worry, captain!" Erin reassures you. "Sol System is under the protection of the Erimosi, who have been in space many centuries longer than the Yathi. Your home system is completely safe. As for why you should contact them, Sol System is very close to Yathi space. It is inevitable that your two species will come into contact. All the more reason to establish relations sooner rather than later."

You sigh with both relief and worry. You're glad that Earth has such powerful patrons, but at the same time that doesn't do you much good way out here. "So Earth is safe, but they still get to eat me, great. Tell me more about them."

"I told you not to worry, captain. Besides, eating sentients would go against the Yathi honor code." Erin says, which is at least somewhat reassuring. "They have other methods of dealing with people they don't like!" Not reassuring. "Anyway, Yathi culture has a strong sense of hierarchy. Individuals establish dominance over others, who then submit. Those above are bound to protect the ones below them; and those that submit are bound to obey their superiors. I recommend not showing any signs of weakness, Captain. The Yathi will not be able to resist exploiting it."

"Noted, Erin." You say, trying not to fear this race of Amazonian wolf-people. At least, that's how their starting to seem in your mind. "How do you recommend I make first contact with this kind of race?"

"Visiting their home world is not advised." Erin tells you sternly. "Not only would you be at the mercy of millions of Yathi, but the gravity would be uncomfortable for a human, and unhealthy over prolonged periods without an exo-suit. However, there are a few protocols for contacting aggressive species.

"First, I recommend contacting as small a population as possible. We could land on the outskirts of their newest colony world, and make contact with a single individual. Once you have made successful contact, you would be able to speak with the Yathi on equal footing." Erin says primly.

"What exactly does 'successful contact' entail, Erin?" you ask her, concerned.

"Well…" Erin trails off for a moment, as if hiding something. "There is always establishing dominance. Their newest world has relatively low gravity, which may give you some small advantage. I believe in you, Captain!"

You groan, the confidence of a computer not exactly helping. "You said there were other options as well?"

"Yes. Option two is to contact a Yathi vessel. The Erimosi do not believe they will fire on a first contact scout ship, instead preferring to bring you aboard. From there, you can communicate your intentions on their ship. The military command structure, plus the fact that such a ship should only hold four or five Yathi, indicate potential for success.

"Finally, while the Erimosi usually do not like to interfere with first contact situations, in this instance they may allow for… assistance." Erin says, sounding reluctant to even give this option. Again, you're surprised by how much emotion a ship AI can convey. "A damaged Yathi vessel was intercepted by a passing Erimosi starship. They could only rescue one of the Yathi, which is receiving medical treatment onboard. This may allow you to make contact with the Yathi under more… beneficial terms. However, the Erimosi have programmed me to stress that productive first contacts are made without outside interference, and I am not allowed to recommend this option. But if you choose it, I'll take you there."

Three interesting choices. First, meeting a lone Yathi on a remote world might be best. You'd learn about each other one on one, and then slowly meet more. But you could also be viewed as an enemy spy or something, if they're really that warlike. Meeting one of their military ships sounds crazy, but then again they might not be so aggressive if they don't feel threatened, and a strong military code of conduct keeps their instincts in check. And finally, you'd choose the last option in a heartbeat if it weren't for Erin's reluctance. The last thing you want to do if anger the Erimosi, and it sounds like they have their reasons for thinking it’s a bad idea. But it'd be so easy to show your good intentions if the Yathi were weak and docile enough to not try anything on you! Thinking it over for some time, you decide on a course of action:
112.title: Yathi

choices: She’s hostile and thinks you are a spy
She’s friendly and believes your peaceful intent
1121.content:
“Let’s go to the Yathi colony,” you announce. “I think I’ll be able to learn the most about the Yathi there.”

“Alright, I’ll just get the warp engines set,” Erin declares, seeming happy that you chose this option. Within a minute, the engines are ready, and she continues, “I’m engaging the warp drive. This might feel a little weird.” Suddenly, you feel the warp engines activate, and you are thrust back in your seat. Your whole head becomes cloudy, and it takes you a minute to reset after the ship slows down from the jump. When you finally come to it, you see a small planet in your view screen. “In English, this colony’s name is Feather Hole. It is 45% land and 65% water, and the water makes the land appear very green from outside. The gravity here is at about 50% of Earth’s, which would make it just 3% of the gravity on the Yathi home world. Since the gravity is so low, the Yathi are fairly uncomfortable, making them a little less effective at being hostile. The air is about 50% oxygen, so you will want to keep your helmet on. That is all I have.”

“Thank you, Erin,” you respond. “Any other advice on dealing with the Yathi?”

“Make sure you meet a lone Yathi,” Erin advises. “This will make sure that you are the safest that you can be. Secondly, if you can find a weakness on the Yathi, use it against them. If you establish dominance, the Yathi will be bound to obey you by their honor code. Going along with this, I want to remind you to not show weakness. They will exploit any weakness they find on you to try to get you to submit to them. Lastly, be confident! Especially with the low gravity here, the Yathi will be less likely to be aggressive if you appear confident that you can establish dominance over them. You can make successful contact with the Yathi and will if you are confident!”

“Alright,” you answer Erin with a little sureness, giving yourself at least a small chance to survive this. “Where would be the best place for us to land?”

“I found a hill on the north side of the planet,” Erin proclaims. “There appears to be a single Yathi headed there, but I do not detect any other Yathis in the area. It might be your best chance to meet a lone Yathi. Should I land us there?”

“Please do so,” you confirm. Erin guides the ship down slowly, and you get out of the ship, your suit and helmet still on. “How far away is the Yathi?”

“She is about a mile away, and she should see the ship soon,” Erin notifies you. “You should meet her a little away from here, but do not stray too far. It will be better if she has to walk longer than you, as she will be a little more exhausted. I will be able to talk with you through your suit’s translator, and I will give you advice as needed. You can do this, Captain!”

“Thanks for the faith in me,” you confidently say, believing that you can make good relations -with a relatively tired Yathi. You walk about one hundred yards and then wait for the Yathi to come to you. Once the Yathi is about two hundred yards away from you, you call out, “Hello! I am a human from Earth, and I have come to establish peaceful relations with the Yathi!”

“Hello!” the Yathi calls out as she approaches you quickly, stopping a few feet away from you. “My name is Lieutenant Quiana, and I am a patrol officer here.” What does Quiana do next?
1121.title: Go to the Yathi colony

choices: She trips, and you are able to restrain her
11211.content:
“You are lying,” Quiana claims. “You are an enemy spy, and you want to get details on this land so that you can try and take it over.”

She lunges at you, but you are able to avoid the first strike. “That is a lie,” you deny. “I am here on a peaceful mission. Why would I have called out to you if I was a spy?” You back away, but Quiana copies your movement, so you get a safe distance away before you continue trying to reason with her. “If I was spying here, you would have never seen me. I came in peace.”

Not convinced, Quiana charges at you, and you turn and run back towards your ship. “I am trained to spot spies, and I caught you before you could react,” she counters your argument. “Now I will take you as a prisoner and find out what you know!” Quiana is faster than you, and she is very close to you when…
11211.title: She thinks you are a spy

112111.content:
Suddenly, you feel the large form of the Yathi tackling you. Quiana pins you down to the ground, and she wrestles your arms behind your back. Unable to move, you have no choice but to let her handcuff your wrists, and then she chains your ankles together. “Now, when are the humans going to attack here, spy?” the Yathi interrogates as she turns you over onto your back.

“Like I said before, I am here to make peaceful contact with the Yathi,” you insist. “Most humans do not even know…” Your speech trails off as you see Quiana reach her hands down, and suddenly, her fingers hit your belly, tickling it. Ticklish and surprised, you burst out in laughter. “HAHAHAHA! WHAHAHAT AHAHARE YOUHUHU DOHOHOING?” The Yathi does not answer but keeps tickling you without mercy as you squirm left and right. “HAHAHAHAHA! NOHOHOHO!”

“When are the humans going to attack?” Quiana demands to know. “You can stop the tickling by telling me.”

“WEHEHE AHAHAHREN’T GOHOHOHOING TOHOHO AHAHATTAHAHACK!” you claim as the tickling continues. “IHIHIHI JUHUHUST GAHAHAHAT HEHEHERE RIHIGHT BEHEHEFOHORE IHIHI SAHAHAW YOUHUHU! PLEHEHEHEHESE STAHAHAP!”

“You’re lying,” Quiana declares as she continues to tickle your stomach, which feels as if it is bare because of the spacesuit. You are reduced to hysterical laughter as the Yathi tickle interrogates you, but as she keeps tickling, your captor realizes that you are telling the truth. At this, she changes tactics. “Do you submit to me?”

“YEHEHEHES!” you give in, willing to do anything to escape the tickling. “STAHAHAHAP!”

Having your submission, Quiana slows down and then stops the tickle torture. “You are weak, human,” she announces. “You submitted to me, so you must obey everything I say to you. Come with me. I am taking you…”
112111.title: Caught!

112112.content:
Crash! You hear something hit the ground, and you glance back. Quiana has fallen down because of the low gravity, and it appears like she has temporarily stunned herself. With an advantage, you quickly get on top of the Yathi and grab handcuffs from off of her, placing them on her wrists. You look over Quiana and notice some rope on her, so you use this to tie her ankles together. After this, you turn the bound Yathi over and announce, “I tried to come peacefully, but you seem to think that I am some kind of spy. Even after I told you my true mission twice, you refused to believe me. So, what is it going to take for you to make peaceful contact with the human race?”

“I will never submit,” Quiana growls at you.

“Any advice, Erin?” you ask your computer through the translator.

“Well, there is the thing that Yathis use to deal with people they do not like,” Erin pipes in.

“Which is?” you wonder.

“Tickling,” the AI notifies you, putting a surprised look on your face.

“Does it work on them?” you inquire.

“Yes, the Yathi race is very ticklish,” Erin states. “It is probably the only way you will get a Yathi to submit. You can definitely use it to establish dominance over the Yathi.”

“Hmm,” you ponder. “I guess that could work.” You look down at Quiana, who has a puzzled look on her face from only hearing one side of the conversation. Desiring dominance, you decide to tickle her bare…
112112.title: Taking A Prisoner

1121121.content:
You reach your hands down to the tied Yathi and wiggle your fingers over her bare belly. Squeezing her face tightly, Quiana tries to ignore the tickling, but her resistance does not last long. “AHAHAHAHAHAHA!” she bursts out in laughter after ten seconds of tummy tickling.

“Looks like someone’s ticklish,” you comment as you manipulate your fingers on her stomach. “Will you submit to me now and make peaceful contact with the human race?”

“NEHEHEHEHEVER!” the Yathi yells through laughter as she squirms around. “IHIHIHI WIHIHILL NEHEHEVER SUHUHUBMIHIHIT!” Determined to force her to give in, you dig your fingers into the ticklish fur, tickling faster and harder. You keep at this form of tickling for five minutes before you realize that it is not working, although Quiana is laughing fairly hard.

Looking around your prisoner, you pull a small gun out of her pocket, which you fire into the ground around you. The gun fires out a laser, but there is no evidence of damage to the ground, and you assume that you do not have a normal gun in your hand. “What does this gun do?”

“I will never tell you,” Quiana insists.

“You will tell me,” you announce, “or I will test it out on you. What does the gun do?”

“I will never tell you,” Quiana repeats her former answer. “You will never get anything off MEHEHEHEHEHEHEHE!” She starts laughing again when you fire the gun into her stomach. Having known that the gun does not do harm, you figure that it is for torture. Erin told you that the Yathi use tickling for people that they don’t like, so you assume that it is a major form of torture. Keeping your finger on the trigger, you move the gun so it is tickling different parts of her midriff.

Quiana lets out a loud shriek when you hit her bare bellybutton, indicating that it is very a sensitive spot. “Is this your special tickle spot?” you wonder as you keep the laser in her navel.

“HAHAHAHA! STAHAHAHAHAP!” the Yathi screams hysterically. Ignoring her, you continue to fire the laser into the hole in her tummy. After ten minutes of tickle torturing Quiana,
1121121.title: Belly Tickles

choices: What can you tell me about the injured Yathi?
Would it be that distracting to meet other Erimosi?
1123.content:
Despite the misgivings from Erin, and the Erimosi that programmed it into her, you decide that meeting up with the Erimosi ship and meeting an injured Yathi would be the safest choice. "I know you don't like it, Erin. But I think we should rendezvous with that Erimosi ship. Please set a course there."

"Aye, captain." Erin says, still sounding reluctant. "I'll take us there, and relay our situation to the Erimosi captain." With that, you suddenly feel the acceleration of the engine, which quickly delivers you into deep space. Then, without even a warning, Erin pops the warp drive. Perhaps its because you picked the option she didn't want, but without any warning, the warp jump disorients you more than you expect. The stars change and a large vessel pops into your view screen, but you sit there dumbly for a couple minutes as your faculties slowly return to you. The human body just wasn't designed for warp space, even if it only lasts an instant.

"While you're sitting there drooling, I explained our situation to Captain Uriana, of the Erimosi light cruiser." Erin tells you. That massive thing is a light cruiser? You can't imagine what an Erimosi flagship must look like, they've never brought one to Sol system. Still, the light cruiser is larger than even the biggest Earth-made vessels. It makes you glad the Erimosi are on your side, even if they'd prefer you make contact on your own. The Swift Feather heads towards an opening docking bay, and the larger ship engulfs your own.

Since the vessel is Erimosi, you don't even bother to check to see if the atmosphere is compatible. While Erimosi prefer air that's a little higher in oxygen content, it's perfectly suitable to humans. You hop out of airlock and onto the ship, but once there you're met with a fresh surprise. The dress code on this ship is nothing like what you're used to seeing from Erimosi back home! You're used to seeing Erimosi wearing long, conservative robes, making them look like priests or nuns. But the handful of Erimosi you see here are wearing almost nothing! Two of them stand in front of you, with a handful more mulling around in the background, all female. At least that met your expectations, Erimosi men only comprise 10% of the population, and tend not to leave homeworld. But the Erimosi look like they're ready for a day at the beach, each of them wearing the equivalent of a strapless bikini in various bright colors. Their bodies all look like statuesque representations of a human ideal, as if carved out of obsidian, their jet skin revealed to you in all its glory.

One of the Erimosi in front of you steps forward, followed by another. "Greetings, human. I am Captain Uriana. This will be your attaché while on board, Doctor Enoa." She tells you, gesturing to her compatriot. The captain is clothed in a white garment, while the Doctor's are green, making you wonder if those are distinctions between command and medical. Behind them, you notice others wearing red as well. "I understand you are here to meet the Yathi we took on board. Enoa can give you the details, however I have duties to attend to. You will excuse me." You tell the captain that you do in fact understand, and she bows before promptly turning and leaving.

"I'm sure you're wondering about our clothing." Enoa says to you, and you realize that your expression is probably fairly easy to read. "Our research indicated humans would respond best to the robes that you have been accustomed to, at least initially. However, what you see here is more typical for our people. We don't like covering ourselves like you do. You'll find that most humanoids are more like us than like you that way." Enoa tells you, and starts directing you towards a hallway. You nod at the revelation, but in reality its more than a little shocking. You'd love it if they dressed like this all the time, you can't help but linger over the attractive forms of Erimosi officers as they pass by you in the wide corridors of the luxurious looking ship.

At the same time, the Erimosi seem to be returning your gaze just as eagerly. "Enoa, I feel like I'm being stared at a little." You tell her in a low tone, although you hear the Erimosi who just passed you giggle lightly.

"Ah, well most Erimosi have never seen a human before, only heard about them. You may not believe it, but they're very interested in meeting with you. However, on the Captain's orders, I'm the only one assigned to you, and everyone else is to carry on in their duties." Enoa tells you. The idea of all these advanced, not to mention rather attractive, aliens all interested in you is pretty flattering. You'd love to meet with them, and you'd imagine you'd have time despite the mission, but Enoa seems to have indicated otherwise.

"I don't understand, why do I have to be kept away from everyone?" you ask Enoa. A conflicted expression appears over her soft features, and her pale blue eyes look away, a hand playing with her white hair.

"You'd… be a distraction." She finally tells you, after a disconcertingly lengthy pause. "We're actually on a tight schedule, and I can attend to any of your needs. Come, this way! I'll take you to the room in the med bay with the Yathi." Enoa says, changing the subject quickly. Her answer didn't completely answer your questions, and you feel like the Erimosi are hiding something from you. The Captain barely said a word to you before leaving, and now the only person allowed to talk to you is this doctor. Still, Erin did say the Erimosi didn't want you to make first contact this way, and they might have their reasons. You are interfering with whatever they're doing.

As the two of you walk down the corridor, you continue to feel eyes on you from the Erimosi passers by, heading to their stations or to their quarters. Some seem to whisper just outside the hearing range of your translator. And you also notice Enoa's eyes on you every so often as well, furtively glancing when she believes you aren't looking. It's too much to believe that they find you as beautiful as you do them. Is a human that interesting to them? Erimosi weren't supposed to be as curious as humans, that's why they don't explore much!

You try to think of what to say next to Enoa, as you start to reach the medical/biological wing of the ship, certain symbols in the corridor taking on the green shade of the doctor's skimpy clothing.
1123.title: Rendezvous with the Erimosi Vessel

11231.content:
"What can you tell me about the injured Yathi, Enoa?" You ask her, getting down to business and forgetting for now the strange looks and behaviors of the Erimosi. Doctor Enoa nods and readily begins relaying the situation.

"We found her vessel derelict in deep space." Enoa tells you somberly. "There were signs of combat, and this one was the only survivor. We don't know what kind of ship they ran into, or what happened. The survivor was barely alive, but we were able to nurse her back to health, slowly. She didn't make it easy on us. She tried to break half of the med bay and escape to her ship, not that we took it with us. We had to restrain her for her own safety and ours." You notice a slight smirk on the Erimosi's lips as she says this. While it might indicate a dark pleasure at the task, you'd probably be just as smug if you had to deal with such a difficult patient. "She's still weak, and spends much of the day sleeping, but she's regularly conscious now. All she's willing to say is name and rank: Sub-Commander Wura. She won't tell us what happened. We were about to take a more active approach with her, but maybe you can connect with her in a way we can't."

That certainly brings you up to speed. Despite the unfortunate circumstances for this Wura, this is actually just what you wanted. Not only is the Yathi weakened, but also restrained. You can talk to her without having to worry about her attacking you, and hopefully you can get her to be cooperative. Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like the Erimosi have had any luck, although your not sure what Enoa meant by taking a 'more active approach.'

The two of you reach the medical facilities, and Enoa directs you to the Yathi's isolated room. "This is her room. It's completely soundproof for… everyone's sake." The Erimosi doctor explains. "So if you need assistance, just press the green triangle next to the door. I'll let you talk with her alone." While you initially want to protest, you remember that the Erimosi strongly believed in making first contact without their help. You're already getting a major exception this way, so if she's not willing to be in the room with you, the Erimosi have still done more than enough.

You enter the room and see this Sub-Commander Wura in the center, reclined on a slightly elevated bed. She looks to be asleep, giving you a chance to examine her for a moment. Her forearms are in restraints high above her head, looking like they were stuck their with alien duct tape. Her shins are bound similarly, and a strap of some kind ties her waist to the bed tightly. It doesn't look like she has much room to maneuver. Wura is tall, probably around six and a half feet or so. Her feet stick out just over the edge of the bed, and you note the claws at her toes. Short, light grey fur covers her entire body. From her neck, down to her chest and stomach, and all the way to her inner thighs is a lighter fur of an underbelly, in a silver-white. You can detect the outlines of muscles on her arms and legs, which make you thankful for the restraints. You can also see the outlines of her abs through the short fur, toned slightly short of a hard six-pack. She also has a full chest modestly covered by a green garment presumably given by the medical staff here. Her face has a soft, content expression, as if having a pleasant dream. But you can notice the sharp teeth underneath her gentle smile.

You clear your throat to get her attention, having examined her long enough. Her eyes flutter awake, and you see the vertical pupils focus on you within the golden irises. A growl rumbles in her throat. You speak quickly, trying to make your intent clear. "Hello, Wura. I'm a human, from a planet called Earth, and I'm here to…"

"So you’re here to interrogate me, are you?!" Wura sneers. "Those Erimosi couldn't do the dirty work themselves! You won't get any more than I've already said, I'm not telling you anything about my vessel or my mission." The look she gives you would make you feel like a trapped deer, if it weren't for the restraints that don't budge at all under her tugging.

"No, I'm here to contact the Yathi, to establish relations between our races! I don't…" Before you can tell Wura that you really don't care about her mission, her ship, or any of the things she doesn't want to tell you, she interrupts you again.

"Let me out of these! Take me back to my ship!" She demands haughtily. "I don't need your charity, if that's what you call this!" She continues to berate you, and with frustration you step outside the chamber, needing a moment of calm to think.

Enoa appears from another room and arches an eyebrow at you in a human gesture. "She thinks I'm here to interrogate her for you. And I can't get through to her without her yelling at me!" You exclaim in frustration. "I just don't know what to do to get her to stop growling and yelling and listen to me for a minute." You scratch your head, trying to come up with a solution.

"Well, if you want her to stop talking, there is something you could try…" Enoa tells you, her eyes gleaming with some kind of energy. "You wouldn't know it, human, but Yathis are actually very… ticklish. And with her bound up with this, you have an effective method of making her more cooperative." Enoa flashes you a wide grin as you gape in surprise. That certainly wasn't a method you'd think of, especially for a proud warrior race like the Yathi. But now that you think about it, even after five minutes you already want to teach this Wura some manners. With a nod and a grin of you own, you thank Enoa for the information and head back into the room.

Wura is just glaring at you now, as if waiting for you to speak first just for the sake of yelling over you. But you glance over her stretched out form: her inner arms and taut underarms are exposed, as is the entirety of that hard looking midriff. And you also look down at those clawed feet sticking out from the edge of the bed. You have plenty of options to see if you can get Wura into a bit of a better mood. But where to start this new ticklish tactic?
11231.title: The Injured Yathi

choices: Feet, paws, whatever you want to call them
Somewhere else... maybe her ears? Neck? Thighs? Or even her breasts?
112311.content:
You climb onto her dais, wondering silently, "Are aliens ticklish where humans are?" You feel like this would be a great way to find out. You crawl behind the glaring Yathi, who still hasn't said a word, then stroke your fingers down her duct taped lower arms, enjoying the sudden change in mood for Wura. Her muscled arms tense up in ticklish anticipation; her mouth trying to hold in the giggles that she knew would give away her secret, a secret that you already knew.

"What are you doing?" Wura demands, her mouth curling into an involuntary smile as your hands slide closer to her underarms. She must be pretty ticklish if she's already smiling from even the hint of tickling her.

"I just wanted to talk like civilized beings, but you wouldn't let me talk. So I thought this might help calm you down." As you speak, your hands continue their journey down Wura's arms, now teasing her exposed upper arms. "Unless you feel like it isn't necessary for me to continue?" You glare in return at the Yathi, figuring even an alien could figure out a sarcastic stare.

Never dropping her tough girl attitude, Wura growls, "I'll never talk. Let me out of he-hahahahahastopthat!" Your fingers have finally reached their destination, Wura's exposed armpits. You spider tickle them lightly, which is still enough to cause the ticklish Yathi to giggle and struggle in her restraints. Her giggles evolve into snickers and chuckles as you press into the flesh of her sensitive underarms, caressing her nerves with ticklish sensations. Wura seems to have dropped her earlier restraint, her beautiful laughter flows freely out of her mouth. You're actually enjoying the Yathi's laughter, not to mention her helplessness. You continue to tickle the defenseless Yathi silly, running your hands down her ribcage quickly, which causes a yelp from Wura, then run your hands back up to her underarms. This must be hard on her, you think, remembering what Erin told you about the Yathi, she was probably trained not to show weakness, and being tied up probably doesn't help that.

"Mercymercyhahahahahastop!" The poor Yathi manages to plead through her laughter. You recall that the Yathi determine ranks in their society through submission; whoever submits to another must obey that person without question.

"Mercy is sounding a bit better. Maybe now you're ready to talk?" You almost want her to keep fighting, you really enjoyed tickling her. Wura didn't respond to your question, instead using her energy to struggle against the duct tape once more. You feel like a little more tickling will finally break the Yathi. The question was, where?
112311.title: Her Underarms

choices: Get down to business,  Wura is finally ready to talk
1123113.content:
Grinning to yourself, you look over an exhausted Wura. The werewolf like creature pants on her dais, try to recover from your tickly assault. "Perhaps it's time to try something different." You think, quickly stepping out of the room. You return brandishing a long slim feather, courtesy of the Erimosi. Wura glares over at you, looking annoyed, then spits through bared teeth," I already told you, human, I'm not going to talk. Now let me ou- gahahahaha!" You shut Wura up fast with a few quick strokes of your feather in her underarms again. The ticklish Yathi giggles and squirms, not at the level she was before, but enough to show that she's still being tickled by the feather. You look down into her fierce uellow eyes, then say," For the last time, Wura, I'm not here to interrogate you." You see Wura briefly giving you a defiance look, before bursting into laughter again. "I just want to talk without having you scream at me every few seconds. Can we do that?"

The Yathi, with obvious difficulty, growls," You will never get anything from me!" You sigh, not truly disappointed, then say," So be it." You drop your feather, then suddenly reach down and tickle Wura's thighs. The Yathi yelps, trying to pull away with no success. Her beautiful laughter grows in volume significantly as you amp up the tickling on her thighs. You tickle the inside of Wura's legs, feeling her hard muscles resisting under her short fur. You smile, teasing the Yathi's thighs and enjoying the laughes that come from her because of it, then suddenly have an idea.

You reclaim the fallen feather, temporarily stopping Wura's tickle torture. Without giving her too much of a chance to recover, you climb back up to her stomach, sitting down. Then, you quickly run the feather over the top of Wura's breasts. The surprised Yathi giggles, her eyes widening as she realized your intent. Grinning slyly, you slide your hands behind her furry back, undoing the straps to her medical clothing. It slides off, and you get your first look at a Yathi's chest. The breasts are large and well formed; Wura glares at you with a similar expression as if she was a hungry wolf and you were a cowering rabbit. You don't let that faze you as you run the feather all over her chest, teasing the ticklish Yathi. Wura still giggles as the feather tickles her, but something else is in her expression, something that almost looks like she wants you to go on. You're surprised at the realization, thinking," Maybe aliens aren't so different from humans after all. Wura seems to be a fine example." The last part of the thought puts a smile on your face as you continue to tickle the defenseless Yathi.

About a half hour passed before you finally stopped playing with the Yathi's chest. You feather tickle Wura's neck, which almost causes you to get your hand bitten off, then switch to her ears, a place out of the reach of Wura's mouth. Her ears twitch in response to the feather, the Yathi still giggling. After a few more minutes of tickling, the Yathi finally gives up, saying," I submit! Just stop tickling me, please!"

Wura pants as you remove the feather from her body. Now you must decide what kind of a person you are:
1123113.title: How about all of the above?

choices: ...tickle you until you submit to ME."
...get some help from some of the staff you've disrespected."
11231132.content:
The poor girl's tongue was finally loosened. That means it's time for some real diplomacy, and also a lot of fun. Remembering what you've learned about the Yathi, you decided that it would be better for humanity to take a more... aggressive stance towards its warlike neighbors. After all, this is a very power structure based species, so if your first interaction showed the Yathi that humanity isn't to be pushed around, friendly relations would probably come much easier. Besides, the Erimosi's diplomatic protection would prevent a war, should worst come to worst, you figured.

You lifted the feather in front of Wura's helpless left armpit. She flinched and whimpered.
"Don't you dare look away from me when I tickle you!," you command, stroking her horribly sensitive underarms with the feather and your fingers. She gasped and started giggling, but soon managed to look you directly in the eyes through her laughter.
"That's better. You are to address me and everyone else on this ship as your superior, do you understand?" you say, ceasing your tickly assault, looking into her panting face. You keep the feather poised over Wura's helpless armpit threateningly. She nodded her head hesitantly.

You lean your head next to hers and speak authoritatively, "I am a human. I heard of a Erimosi vessel with a wounded Yathi on board. I thought it would be a good chance to make first contact with your species. However, you refused to even speak to me! I do not think that humanity deserves such an insult! Do you?!"

She hesitated and started stuttering, "I, uh, I... I didn't know! I du-AHAHAHAHAHA!!! NO!!!! PLHEEEHEHEHEHEHEEESE! GAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAH"

You cut her off by finger tickling her right armpit, massaging the extra-fine fur on it. In a galaxy where the warfare was based on tickling, it must surely be a massive liability to have armpits that were so pleasant to stroke, to say nothing of what having such soft fur pressed into your most ticklish spots would feel like... you smiled at her forced mirth and the tears that were starting to form in her eyes, and you did so rather smugly. You traced circles on the inside of her exposed, firm belly button with the quill of your feather while your fingers slowly and methodically massaged and felt their way around her armpit.

"Now as restitution, you will pay this debt of honor with your laughter and freedom!"
That sounded pretty official! You were pretty surprised with yourself.

"AAAAAAAHHAHAHAHAH! I'LL TELL YOU ANYTHING YOU WANT TO KNOW!!!!" she yelled, the desperation clear in her eyes and voice before she melted back into laughing.

"How many times do I have to tell you that I'm not here to interrogate you? I came here to establish relations, and you refused to talk to me like a reasonable person. So now I'm have to punish you for your insolence," you explain, as if to a child why they have to sit in time out for 5 minutes.

You spun the feather around in your hand and started poking and stroking her belly button with the quill, driving her laughter to silence, a ear to ear smile plastered on her face. Her sharp fangs suddenly seemed much less scary. You let her linger on the brink of ticklish oblivion for several seconds until you finally stop to let her breathe. She seemed grateful for the break, and while she focused on panting, you thought of your next step.

You could get Wura to submit to you personally. That would let you gather information on the Yathi on your terms, and if domination is so prevalent in their culture, perhaps having one submit to the first human to explore the galaxy would deter the Yathi from showing aggression toward humans as we expand throughout the galaxy.

You rest your hand on top of Wura's head and stroke it gently, almost lovingly. She tenses up at first and then relaxes, glad that you haven't started tickling her again. You seem to have tickled most of her bad attitude and defiance out of her, and you can't deny you had fun doing it! If she submits to you, you would be able to restrain and tickle her on a whim. Not to mention how fun to would be to have her stripped completely naked while you tickled her into entire submission. If Yathi are ticklish like humans, perhaps they have other humanlike vulnerabilities to exploit...

On the other hand, if you didn't want to take Wura as your slave, you could certainly just keep teaching her about how important it is to treat sentients with respect. In fact, since you've already technically made your first contact, and Enora is supposed to attend to your every need... well, another pair of hands would certainly help you drive the point home. In fact, Enora would probably enjoy helping you, and would possibly even be willing to be more flexible with the rules considering all the trouble Wura has caused! It would also be educational to see just how effective an Erimosi can be at tickling, maybe you could even learn a thing or two!

You scritch on Wura's taut underarms to make her jump and giggle, and then you keep it up for a few seconds while you speak, "Break's over. In light of your rude and aggressive behavior, I've decided to..."
11231132.title: Featherpoint Diplomacy

choices: An alarm goes off in the ship!
112312.content:
You climb onto the bed, kneeling between her legs. Leaning over, you place both your hands on either side of her taut stomach. You can feel the musculature of her abs under the soft silver fur. Sub-Commander Wura continues to silently glare at you, although you think you can see a curious and concerned look in her sky-blue eyes. With a grin, you curl your fingertips and slowly drag them down her stomach, dragging along her fine fur and feeling her stomach tense underneath your touch.

"What are you doing?" the Yathi asks in a rushed voice, her face tensing as she tries not to react to what you're doing. "Stop that! Don't touch me!" Her eyes dart between your face and your fingers, as she tries to keep her body from betraying her, from giving away her secret. But unfortunately for her, you already know.

"I wanted to talk, and I wanted to ask for your help." You tell her calmly, as your fingers slide down her stomach agonizingly slowly, something Wura is clearly trying very hard to ignore. "But you wouldn't even listen to me. So I'm going to do this until you start feeling a little more cooperative. Unless you're willing to listen to me now?" You arch your eyebrow at her, a gesture that's probably lost on the alien, who doesn't seem to notice your skepticism.

"Rrr, I have nothing to say to you, Erimosi pawn! Let me g-ehehehee!" Your fingers had reached the end of their patient journey, getting to her waistline. Then they had started back up again, this time raking against the grain of her fur. This was too much for the Yathi to control without laughing, as you feel her lower belly ripple under your touch. She begins to giggle, a very pleasant sound to your ears. Her face contorts into a wide grin, and aside from the row of sharp, pointy teeth, it's a pleasant expression. If you could get Wura to be nicer to you, she'd probably be pleasant company. At least she wouldn't be hard on the eyes.

But it'll take more than one little tickle to get her to that point, you realize. And honestly, you don't want to stop so soon. Your fingers scratch up her belly, and then repeating the process. Down and up her stomach, your tickling increasing in speed with each movement. Wura tosses her head back, trying in vain to control herself, snickers and chortles slipping past her lips continuously. Your fingers idly zigzag their way up and down her belly, with all the patience in the world. Enoa, the Erimosi doctor, wasn't lying, Wura really is ticklish! It probably doesn't help that she's tied down without any means of defending herself, her body stretched out for you to play with.

You skitter your fingers along her waistline, just above the green medical garment that might as well be underwear. It seems to be a particularly effective spot on Wura, as her hips buck and her laughter ratchets up a notch. You linger there, tickling in a quick, constant pace, watching her with a grin. "Nahahahahaha! No stahahahahap! Plehehehease nohohoho!" Wura sputters between fits of laughter.

Please? Well, you seem to be making some progress if she's willing to ask nicely. "Are you willing to cooperate? Can we talk like civilized sentients now?" You ask her pointedly, without stopping the tickling. You don't want to give her a chance to recover her resolve, and honestly you've found a very fun spot to exploit. Wura doesn't respond, just lying back and continuing the writhe and laugh. You feel like you're close to getting her, just a little more...
112312.title: Her Belly

choices: nothing happens! Choose a spot and tickle the Yathi senseless.
uh oh... Why does Enoa need to see you now..?
112313.content:
You quickly duck down near the edge of the bed, knowing that the element of surprise will make your tickling that much unbearable. In a placating tone, you say," I just wanted to establish relations with your race, Wura, but you wouldn't even let me talk." You let a single finger touch the heel of the Yathi, then let it wander her foot, tickling all the way. Wura growls, but it sounds more faked than threatening. She struggles to hold back the giggles that your fingers are eliciting from her feet, giggles that would give away her secret.

You continue to tease the bound Yathi's foot, feeling her pulling back in an attempt to alleviate the sensations. "I've heard your race is very, ticklish... Wura. Maybe this will convince you to talk?" You ask, adding a second finger to the gentle tickling on Wura's sole. The silver Yathi again pulls at her restraints, then finally allows a giggle to escape her clenched teeth.

Despite the fact that she's tied up and helpless, Wura still barks," I'll never talk with you, puny human. Now I demand you stop and Ahahahahaha!" You can't help but admire Wura's resilience, but you also can't help running your fingers down Wura's soles. You scratch gently in her arches, then quickly tease the area underneath her toes, careful to avoid the sharp claws protruding from them. The ticklish Yathi lets out a stream of laughter, obviously foot ticklish. You continue to torture the bound up alien, now rotating your fingers between the sensitive spots of Wura's toes. You're actually enjoying listening to the Yathi's helpless laughter, and to extract more, you tickle the pads of Wura's toes. The poor Yathi is howling with laughter, pulling at the duct tape the Erimosi bound her with. You remember that Erin told you that ranks in the Yathi race are determined through combat and submission. "She must absolutely hate this, being so helpless." You think, your fingers making another journey down to Wura's arches.

After a few more minutes of foot tickling, Wura manages to say through her laughter, " PLEASESTOPHAHAHAHAMERCY!" "Maybe she's ready to talk?" You think to yourself, aiming the same question at a still laughing Wura. The Yathi doesn't respond, but it's clear it won't take much more to convince her to talk. You're about to start tickling another body when...
112313.title: Her Feet

11232.content:
“What’s your job on the cruiser, Enoa?” you wonder, trying to lighten up the conversation.

“I am the foreign species doctor,” Enoa responds. “This means that I take care of any foreign species that are injured on the ship. In addition, I am typically the officer who interacts with any aliens who come on the ship, such as you.”

“So, how often do you get to see other species?” you inquire.

“Quite often, actually,” Enoa notifies you. “Representatives from our allies are allowed on board often, and I show them around with assistance from military Erimosi. As I hinted at before, I also treat them if they get injured, and if any tests are needed, I administer them. In addition, in the evenings, when they are not on official business, I entertain them and make sure they are comfortable during their stay.”

“How do you entertain them?” you question, curious.

“I could explain it, but it would be easier to just show you,” Enoa answers. “Would you like to be entertained?”

“That would be fine with me,” you declare, and the Erimosi guides you to an empty room in the medical bay.

“I would take you to another room, but there would be too many other Erimosi,” she proclaims. “This space will actually do well for the entertainment. I am sure that you will enjoy this; the foreign species doctors on other ships have informed me that this method works well on humans. Please remove your spacesuit and shoes and then lie down on the examination table.” You look at Enoa questioningly, but she gives you an insistent gaze, so you remove your shoes and the spacesuit, leaving you in just your underwear. Feeling a little exposed, you lie down on the examination table and look up at the doctor. “You look a little uncomfortable. Why?”

“Well, I am just in my underwear,” you reply. “That isn’t normal for humans.”

“Like I said earlier, most humanoids don’t like covering themselves up,” Enoa announces. “The entertainment is more effective if I can see your skin. Is it alright if I begin?”

“I guess so,” you affirm, and the doctor’s hands come down and start tickling your bare belly. “AHAHAHA! THAHAT TIHIHICKLEHES!”

“Why, of course it does,” Enoa states as you squirm around. “Tickling is a wonderful way to entertain someone, and it looks like you’re very ticklish.” Her fingers spider all over your stomach, exploiting your sensitivity.

Hysterically laughing, you manage to gain your bearings enough to wriggle onto your back, and you cover your sides with your arms. The doctor ceases her tickling attempts when you turn over, and then you turn your head to her. “You entertain people by tickling them?”

“Yes, believe it or not, tickling is a very common form of entertainment,” the Erimosi informs you. “Nearly all species are ticklish, and the vast majority of them like being tickled. In fact, after a long day of work, most foreign representatives don’t mind letting me tie them up and tickle them. They get a safe word, and when they need me to stop, they say it. It’s a way to make sure they don’t hurt me and also ensure that I don’t tickle them past their limits, and both sides have lots of fun. You look like someone who could use a little tickle therapy. Would you mind being tied up and tickled? I’ll give you a safe word so it doesn’t turn into tickle torture.”

“I guess I could do it,” you respond. “I did come here to learn about how aliens interact so I can have productive contacts, and this is somewhere to start.”

“Alright, I’ll tie you to this examination table,” Enoa broadcasts. “Turn over and put your arms up. I want to have full access to that ticklish tummy of yours.” Reluctantly, you roll over so that you are on your back again, and you raise your arms in the air, exposing most of your tickle spots. The doctor pulls out a strap from under the table and uses it to secure your arms, and then she restrains your ankles with a strap at the bottom of the table. “Your safe word is going to be ‘Red’. Is that alright?” You nod to confirm this. “Good. Well, I think we should start the tickle therapy on your…”
11232.title: Enoa's Job

11233.content:
“Enoa, would I really be that distracting if I met with other crew members?” you ask her, puzzled. “I was told that the Erimosi aren’t a curious species like humans. So why am I so interesting here?”

Enoa looks furtively, and seems reluctant to tell you anything. But after a moment she acquiesced, telling you “That is true, we aren’t a curious species like humans. Humans seem to be interested in everything, poking their fingers into every topic and place they can find.” The human phrase is ‘poking their noses,’ but you don’t correct her. “It’s true we explore the galaxy very slowly, and only when we see something that interests us.
